title: Residence Inn Seattle University District Hotel
review_list:

This property just opened on Friday, January 23. I stayed for one night shortly after opening. The hotel has nice, modern rooms and everything is pristine, as one would expect from a new hotel. This is one of the closest hotels to the University of Washington campus, just about 5 blocks away. As might be expected with a new property, there were glitches. The hot water to the bathroom sink wasn't working, but I was able to fix it by just opening the valve under the sink. The electronic key card I was issued did not open the door to my room, and the staff never was able to diagnose the problem before I checked out. They tried very hard to solve the problem and were very apologetic as they repeatedly accompanied me to my room to open it with a master key. Overall the staff were excellent. Once the bugs are worked out, this should be a prime property for the Residence Inn brand. I would stay here again if I am in the area.
